description: Erection of single and part two storey rear extensions with associated changes to fenestration
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The flat roof element(s) of the extensions hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.9 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and 5 objections from 4 separate addresses have been received relating to:- Excessive height or bulk of buildings- Inappropriate design/layout- Privacy- Unacceptable or incompatible useThe concerns raised will be taken into consideration during the assessment of the application and detailed below.The key areas of assessment are: - The design of the proposed development; - The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings; and, - Fire Safety Assessment.DesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed boundary wall would propose a mixture of brick columns and metal railings, and would measure approx. 1.8m max in height. Officers note that the proposed boundary wall would make use of materials viewed on the original dwelling and as such would not appear out of keeping with the character and appearance of the original dwelling. While officers note that the boundary treatment within the immediate area are mostly low level brick walls, given the use of materials, the proposed boundary treatment would not appear out of character with the prevailing pattern of development within the area.Officers note that the applicant has not provided side elevations for the proposed dormer, or proposed drawings for the proposed outbuilding. In the absence of this information, Officers are unable to make a full assessment as to whether the proposal would respect the character and appearance of the original building as well as the character of the surrounding area.AmenityPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance. Officer Comment: As mentioned above, the applicant has not robustly demonstrated the scale of the proposed outbuilding or rear dormer roof extension and as such officers are unable to make a full assessment as to the impact of the proposed development on neighbouring amenity. In the absence of this information, it is likely that the proposed development would adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy. TransportationPolicy T6 of the London Plan 2021 states that car parking should be restricted in line with levels of existing and future public transport accessibility and connectivity. The maximum standards as set out in policies T6.1 to T6.5 should be applied to development proposals.Policy DM9, Policy DM10 and the Council's Sustainable Transport SPD 2013 together require development proposals to comply with the car parking standards in the London Plan.Officer Comment: While the proposal would erect front boundary treatment, given that the proposal would allow for adequate visibility, it is considered not to have an adverse impact upon car parking provision, traffic congestion or highway safety, in compliance with Policy DM9 and DM10.Fire Safety AssessmentLondon Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.Officer Comment: The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

For the avoidance of doubt, please confirm the description 'Demolition of existing side extension, erection of two storey side and single storey front porch and rear extension. Hip to gable roof extension with rear dormer and juliet balcony and installation of 3 nos front rooflights.'
